== Optional Exercise: Internationalization for the application model
=== Target In this exercise you translate the relevant parts of your application model and use the translation service.
=== Create the translations for the application model
Create the _OSGI-INF/l10n_ folder in your `com.example.e4.rcp.todo` plug-in.
Create the _bundle.properties_ file with key/values for the parts in your application model in this folder. The file might look like the following.
[source,java] ---- include::res/i18n/bundle.properties[] ----
Create at least one additional translation file for another language. For example, if English is your default language, create the _bundle_de.properties_ file to provide a German translation. Ensure that the translation values are different.
=== Adjust the build.properties file
Add the created property files to your build.properties file in the `com.example.e4.rcp.todo` plug-in to make it available in an exported application.
=== Translate the application model Use the defined keys with the % prefix in your application model. The following screenshot demonstrates that for a part.
image::exercise_appmodel_translation10.png[Using the translation keys in the application model,pdfwidth=60%]
=== Test the translation of the application model
Ensure that the application works well for the languages you provided translations for. You can set the language in your launch configuration by using the -nl_ start parameter as described in
You have to change the launch configuration. Setting the language via the product file does not work, as the nl parameter is currently not correctly transferred to the launch configuration. See https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=461371">PDE Bug report for details.
=== Application model and translations
By default, it is not possible to define that the translations for the application model are located in another plug-in. If you want this, you have to implement your custom translation service.
